CONJUGATES: person (sg) | people (pl) | peoples (pl, for distinct groups) | peoples (v. 3rd sg pres) | peopled (v. past/pp) | peopling (v. pres p)
ETYMOLOGY: From Old French poeple, peuple, from Latin populus 'the people, a nation, a community'.
SINCE: Late 13th century (as a noun, meaning 'persons collectively')

MEANINGS.DEF_EN: Human beings in general; individuals of a community or group. (This is the most common plural form of 'person').
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: 人类，人们；某个群体或社区的个体。（这是'person'最常见的复数形式。）
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: Many people around the world are learning English.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 世界上很多人都在学英语。

MEANINGS.DEF_EN: The citizens or inhabitants of a country or state; the general public, often seen as a collective entity.
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: 一个国家或州的公民或居民；通常指作为集体实体的大众或人民。
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: The will of the people must be respected by the government.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 人民的意愿必须得到政府的尊重。

MEANINGS.DEF_EN: A body of persons united by a common culture, tradition, language, or sense of kinship; an ethnic group or nation.
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: 因共同文化、传统、语言或血缘关系而团结在一起的一群人；一个民族或国家。
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: The indigenous peoples of North America have diverse cultures.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 北美原住民拥有多元的文化。

MEANINGS.DEF_EN: To inhabit or reside in; to provide with inhabitants or populate an area.
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: 居住于；为……提供居民，使（某地）有人居住。
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: The island was first peopled by courageous explorers centuries ago.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 这个岛屿几个世纪前首次由勇敢的探险家们居住。
